result.execSummary:
The defendant Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley was found guilty of Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).
  • Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 91 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Steven H. to be paid Joint and Several as a condition of Extended Supervision. Cash bail applied, paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
Not ot use or possess any dangerous weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with co-defendants or any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with co-defendants or any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME. Court grants 180 days credit and grants TIME SERVED.
Concurrent with: Count 5

See Count 4 for additional conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 2 sentence. Concurrent with probation on Count 4.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Paid in full. Balance refunded to Attorney Cotton per bail assignment.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 180 days credit and grants TIME SERVED.

Defendant Arbreon Devon Dunson Lilley in court with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Cotton makes statements regarding sentencing Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

 3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 91 days)
  -   18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -    2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendants or any victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,650.00 to Steven H. - Joint and Several - (to be paid out of cash bail posted- Restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT #4:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS     *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #2*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendants or any victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint
____Not to use or possess any dangerous weapons

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted)


COUNT #5:   WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS     *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #2*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted)
